      message to be displayed on the text box

    • getMessage

      public java.lang.String getMessage()
      Returns:
      entire message to be displayed on the text box

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()
      Returns:
      text box is open

    • toggleIsOpen

      public void toggleIsOpen()
      Toggles between the text box being open and closed.

    • setClosed

      public void setClosed()
      Closes the terminal and clears the stored message.

    • setOpen

      public void setOpen()
      Opens the text box.

    • showBars

      public void showBars()
      Shows the black cutscene bars.

    • hideBars

      public void hideBars()
      Hides the black cutscene bars.

    • shouldShowBars

      public boolean shouldShowBars()
      Returns if the black cutscene bars should be shown or not.
      Returns:
      true if the bars should be shown, false if not

    • handleEscape

      public void handleEscape()
      Handles the escape key being pressed to close to text box.

    • nextMessage

      public void nextMessage()
      If there is a next message, it start to be displayed in the text box, if there is no more messages then the text box will be closed.

    • setSubMessage

      public void setSubMessage()
      The sub message displayed will be updated at a delay of 30ms each character. If the player has pressed a button while it is appearing, then the entire line will ap pear.

    • setSkip

      public void setSkip()
      When the player provides an input while the message is appearing, it sets skip to true which will display the entire message. If skip is true while it is pressed, the next messaged will be displayed.

    • isAcceptingInput

      public boolean isAcceptingInput()
      Checks if the text box is accepting input from the player.
      Returns:
      true if text box can altered with input, false otherwise

    • acceptInput

      public void acceptInput()
      When walking into an entity that triggers a text box to appear, repeatedly holding down a key would instantly cycle through all of the messages. To prevent this, the player needs to press start accepting keyboard input.

    • setDialogue

      public void setDialogue​(Dialogue dialogue)
      Sets the dialogue to a certain message depending on cutscene that is to be displayed.
      Parameters:
      dialogue - the sequence of strings that are to be displayed in the text box

    • setRandomDefeatDialogueSet

      public void setRandomDefeatDialogueSet​(RandomDialogueSet dialogueSet)
      Sets the dialogue set to the set of dialogue determined by the NPC that was reached.
      Parameters:
      dialogueSet - the sequence of strings that are to be displayed in the text box

    • setRandomBeatenDialogueSet

      public void setRandomBeatenDialogueSet​(RandomDialogueSet dialogueSet)
      Sets the dialogue set to the set of dialogue determined by the NPC that was reached.
      Parameters:
      dialogueSet - the sequence of strings that are to be displayed in the text box

    • setRandomFirstEncounter

      public void setRandomFirstEncounter​(RandomDialogueSet dialogueSet)
      Sets the dialogue set to the set of dialogue determined by the NPC that was reached.
      Parameters:
      dialogueSet - the sequence of strings that are to be displayed in the text box

    • setOrderedDialogue

      public void setOrderedDialogue​(RandomDialogueSet dialogueSet)
      This method will be called repeatedly to trigger an ordered sequence of dialogue.
      Parameters:
      dialogueSet - the set of dialogue that dialogue will be retrieved from

    • getRandomDialogueSet

      public RandomDialogueSet getRandomDialogueSet()

    • isMainCharacterShowing

      public boolean isMainCharacterShowing()
      Checks which character will be displaying the text, returns true if the main character is talking, false otherwise
      Returns:
      boolean to determine who is talking

    • setNewCharactersOff

      public void setNewCharactersOff()
      Prevents the timer from recursively calling the method to generate a new character.
